result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald J. Feurt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donald J. Feurt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Donald J. Feurt was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling per agent to include anger management.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges.  No good time.  (If medical condition is an issue, advise agent ASAP).  Jail to commence on or before June 3, 2016.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald J. Feurt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Clerk of Courts to defendant

Review on May 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Review on February 7, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donald J. Feurt in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea to Count 2.  Attorney Henney gives sentencing recommendation.  State agrees and adds some conditions agreed upon.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 2:
24 months Probation, concurrent.
Submit to DNA sample
30 days Sauk County Jail with Huber privileges.  Jail to commence on or before June 3, 2016 at 6:30 p.m.  No good time.  (If medical condition is an issue, advise agent ASAP)
Undergo any counseling per agent to include anger managment.  
AODA & treatment to include mental health treatment.
$243.00 Fine/Costs fees and $200.00 DNA surcharge (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS) 
Paperwork handed in court.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Donald J. Feurt in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Henney gives status.  Matters are resolved, however defendant needs to execute the DPA on one of the matters.  Request 30 days out for deferred sentencing hearing.  Defendant has major medical issues to undergo in the next month.  State advises DPA could be done sooner, however if delay is necessary to work around medical issues, State does not object.  Court request Attorney Henney get a date from Br. 2, Judge Evenson.
Final pre-trial at 03-07-2016 01:00 pm
Jury trial at 03-16-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Donald J. Feurt in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives status. Matters are close to resolution.  State has an unavailable witness, request reset of trial.  Attorney Henney agrees matter is close to resolution and does not object to trial being reset.  Court advises parties to contact Br. 2.
Final pre-trial at 12-14-2015 01:00 pm
Jury trial at 12-17-2015 08:30 am
Final pre-trial at 12-07-2015 01:00 pm

Defendant Donald J. Feurt appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Gives new address.  Attorney ORourke gives explanation for warrant.  Request bond be reinstated.

Attorney Timothy C. Henney in court.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is also hearing case 14CF233. No show by DE. State requesting warrant. Based on no show by the DE, court is authorizing warrant in each case. Court order forf. of cash bond in 14CF437.
Defendant Donald J. Feurt in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Sue Mueller and Rick S. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reset for Sept. 9th.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-09-2015 11:00 am

Status conference at 06-01-2015 01:00 pm

Attorney Timothy C. Henney in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Still waiting medical records.  State objects to any reset and requests warrant.  State states prior hearing Judge Evenson ordered DE to be here today.  Court leave to Judge Evenson and what to set for next.
Status conference on April 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Timothy C. Henney in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Henney requests resets in both matters/matters are resolved.  Need time to obtain some medical records that haven't been received yet.  State objects to one month reset as requested.  Atty Henney responds.  Bonds continued.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Donald J. Feurt in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Henney request more time to submit medical history and information.  Request FPT and JT.  Time limits continued waived.  Global offer was extended.  State request cases track.  Matter reset.  Bond continues.  Status hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on January 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Return date on February 4, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Donald J. Feurt appeared by video means with Attorney Sacra. Prosecuting Atty Kevin R. Calkins appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State request $500.00 cash bond and no contact with M.E.  No warrant history.  Attorney Sacra request smaller cash bond.  Local ties.  Defendant is not employed.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $300.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with M.E. or her residence.  May return to premises one time with law enf. to pick up personal property.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
